{"rule":"ENGLISH_WORD_REPEAT_RULE","sentence":"^\\QA service is provided to the layer above as primitives Primitives are normally system calls\\E$"}

{"rule":"ENGLISH_WORD_REPEAT_RULE","sentence":"^\\QSEND Send a message to a peer.\\E$"}
{"rule":"COMMA_PARENTHESIS_WHITESPACE","sentence":"^\\QAt most one object sent at a time Requires multiple connections to download multiple objects Closes the connection after sending a response 2 RTTs for sending each object ( of RTT = (2 RTT + time to transmit file) \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q of files sent)\\E$"}

{"rule":"CD_NN","sentence":"^\\Q20 byte header usually (Can be 21 bytes if from Telnet) Provides a \"full-duplex\" service Reliable transport, flow control, congestion control (prevents one TCP connection from swamping the links and routers with excess traffic) Strives to give each connection traversing a congested link an equal share of the link bandwidth Regulates the rate of traffic entering the network Does not provide timing, minimum throughput guarantee Not secure, but can use SSL for encryption Used for webpages or anything that requires a specific order RST, SYN, and FIN are used for connection setup and teardown CWR and ECE are used in explicit congestion Notification PSH indicates that the receiver should pas the data to the upper layer immediately URG bit is used to indicate that there is data in this segment that is marked urgent\\E$"}

{"rule":"R_SYMBOL","sentence":"^\\QN3 (R)AN & UPF Facilitates transfer of user data between RAN and core network.\\E$"}
{"rule":"R_SYMBOL","sentence":"^\\QN2 (R)AN & AMF Carries signaling and data between the RAN and the core network.\\E$"}
